Content_wSideColumn.Name: Graduates
Content_wSideColumn.Title: Graduates
Content_wSideColumn.Abstract: Simply put, BYU-Idaho graduates are in demand.

MoveLeft.label: Toggle column right or left (right is default)

Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
The BYU-Idaho Graduate

Get to know a Brigham Young University-Idaho graduate and you will discover a young person ready to work and serve.  A growing number of employers are taking notice of BYU-Idaho students and their moral strength, valuable skills, hands-on training, and leadership ability.  Simply put, BYU-Idaho graduates are in demand.

BYU-Idaho students who choose to further their education through graduate work are well prepared to do so thanks to the university’s wide range of academic offerings and intense courses of study.  Most importantly, students are prepared for the vital roles they will fulfill in their families and the Church.

Elder Henry B. Eyring described the BYU-Idaho graduate this way: "They will be natural leaders who know how to teach and how to learn. They will have the power to innovate and improve without requiring more of what money can buy. Those graduates of BYU-Idaho. . . will become legendary for their capacity to build the people around them and to add value wherever they serve." (Elder Henry B. Eyring, A Steady, Upward Course, Brigham Young University-Idaho Devotional, September 18, 2001).
